text: Bailey School, also known as New Bailey School, is a historic school building located at Springfield, Greene County, Missouri. It was designed by architect William B. Ittner and built in 1931. It is a two-story, red brick building on a concrete foundation with simple Jacobethan Revival style design elements. A long, low one-story warehouse addition on the back wall was added in 1966. (includes 18 photographs from 2016) It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2016. ==References== Category:School buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Tudor Revival architecture in Missouri Category:School buildings completed in 1931 Category:Buildings and structures in Springfield, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Greene County, Missouri
title: Bailey School (Springfield, Missouri)
